Text: What a night in Alabama. Congratulations Katie Britt on winning the runoff. On to November. Katie will make an outstanding Senator for the people of Alabama. I look forward to working with her to turn our country around. https://t.co/YF0IArAvGW
Thank you @RepMcKinley for your years of service and dedication to West Virginia. David and Mary have been champions for our state, and we are better for their service.
Congratulations to the winners of the West Virginia primary last night especially @MooneyforWV and @CarolMillerWV.  We stand united in working for a GOP victory in November.

WV & OH face many of the same issues including combating the opioid epidemic, protecting our energy jobs, and strengthening our workforce. @JaneTimkenOH is a thoughtful and dedicated conservative leader who will tackle these issues head on. I'm proud to endorse her for Senate.

The funding will be allocated to the Huntington Stormwater Utility, Benedum Airport Authority, the Coalfield Development Corporation, and the Putnam Public Service District and maintain over 2,500 jobs and nearly $70 million in private investment into West Virginia communities.
“Improving our economy, revitalizing communities, and creating opportunities for West Virginians has been a top priority of mine since day one," said Senator Capito.

Last month, Senator Capito, as member of the Senate Appropriations Committee, announced over $10 million in federal funding from the Economic Development Administration’s (EDA) to spur economic growth across West Virginia.
